alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 20 at 10:02AM CDT until July 20 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT/4 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall are expected in the Watch area this morning. 1 to 2 inches of rain may fall within an hour in some locations. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following areas, Anderson, Bledsoe, Blount Smoky Mountains, Campbell, Knox, Loudon, McMinn, Meigs, Morgan, Northwest Blount, Northwest Monroe, Rhea, Roane, Scott TN and Southeast Monroe. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EDT/4 PM CDT/ this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and storms are expect to continue in the area, extending the threat of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
